file_content.text: Captain! Who'd have thought, when we met on Coruscant, that I'd be calling you today with a formal Republic briefing?
Personally, I'd prefer there to be nothing "brief" in our encounters.
Does that mean you're coming to Balmorra in person?
[Flirt] I miss you too.
Sadly, I have a deadly allergy to high-energy blaster bolts.
That's not what I remember....
Oh, no?
Ooh, ouch. You'll have to give me a chance to refresh your memory.
Just tell me what I'm doing here.
Let's stick to the mission.
This is a key Republic target.
Senator Dodonna is eager to see how you handle your first mission.
Balmorra was once the Republic's main supplier of everything military. Until the Empire moved in and the Senate voted to turn tail and run.
Which left the Empire holding everything the Republic had commissioned for "Project Nebula."
What's Project Nebula?
Okay, I'll bite.
It was supposed to be the Republic's answer to Imperial aggression.
Top-of-the-line prototype capital ships, ion cannons, cluster missiles and a few experimental goodies.
So we have to...?
The Empire is sending the complete Project Nebula munitions shipment to their front lines.
These are prototypes of top-of-the-line capital ships, ion cannons, cluster missiles... the Republic doesn't stand a chance against them.
Unless you can get in somehow and divert the Nebula shipment to Palliser Station, a Republic base off Corellia.
The Senate didn't think that one through?
Dumb move.
The Voidwolf came in too fast and too hard. The Republic forces fled without much more than their bedclothes.
The Republic spent billions on Project Nebula's weapons, then the Imperials nabbed them before they fired a shot.
And now the Empire is sending the complete Nebula munitions shipment to their front lines. The Republic's got no chance.
You stopped talking. So, here's where you expect me to jump in and do something?
Uh-uh. Stop looking like that.
You think the munitions will pick themselves up and migrate back to the Republic?
You want me to get them back?
Why come to me?
Because sneaking into protected facilities and boosting their cargo isn't part of Republic trooper training.
Senator Dodonna wants you to work with the Balmorran resistance.
They can help you track down the Nebula shipment, then find a way to divert it to Palliser Station, a Republic base near Corellia.
The Empire's not going to leave their best munitions just lying around.
How am I supposed to do that?
The Senator's letting you figure out the "how." Which gives you an interesting opportunity....
No problem.
Then let me add a little spice. Once you've got the Nebula shipment, can the Republic really make you hand it over?
So, dangerous mission behind enemy lines, key importance... how many zeros are we talking?
Let's talk price.
The Republic wants to get the munitions away from the Empire--however, not enough to pay market value.
A smart operator might sell the prototypes back to them piece-by-piece... not that I'm the one who told you.
Now, your contact on the ground is one of the rebels, Numen Brock. Check in with him when you land in Bugtown.
And pick me up a gift, all right, sweetheart? Maybe a Mark-5 assault droid?
Hats off if you can do this thing, Captain.
